body: Just a quick question. Does the patch actually tighten up any of the validation or is it just a better implementation of the existing logic? From a quick look at the code, it seems to me the patch is the latter?
Yes, I was wondering the same. We check the api keys, etc. in `RequestChannel` today. Also, it would be good to include tests if this is indeed fixing a bug.

Don't check in yet, just got a system test failure.

@ijuma @hachikuji @aayars @maxzheng I suspect this is the source of quite a few recent apparently environmental failures. Had at least one test run where pretty much everything failed because exactly one worker always failing to run anything assigned to it despite rsyncing being successful on all the nodes.

Also, I've verified as best I can, but not sure what to do besides a ton of repetitions of tests. Also, this should get backported as far as possible. I have tested the script itself in allocating and running tests.
Can't we add any unit or integration tests for this bug fix?

@ijuma Unfortunately I'm not sure who else would be very familiar. And even though I've looked at this provisioning stuff before, I had forgotten all the details and had to sort them out again to find a workable solution... Longer term the right solution is to just write an AWSCluster implementation for ducktape.
LGTM. I can update the title while merging as long as @hachikuji is good with the producer-end changes.
LGTM
Merged to trunk and 0.11.0.

Thanks @hachikuji I've tried to make it clearer. 
Note that I don't think that the behavior of acks is not well documented , rather I found that when a user goes through the docs for the first time and encounters these concepts, a clarification was needed
We are going to test the patch internally to verify that it solves the problem before checking it in.
